#summary File Format!


Okay... Firstly the file created by the USB export is named BODYDATA.TXT. This is the file that needs to be read in! - Im using a hex editor to read the stored data in the file.

Makeup of the file:

* Each users weight data takes up 18 bytes.<br>
* Each user has 35 slots that they can take up.  The file is padded with empty slots.<br>>

Example Data to be read from file:

Slot 		1 (done)<br>
Time/Date 	08:49:44 (done)<br>
Age		33 (done)<br>
Height		6'01" / 185cm (done)<br>
Weight		13:7.2 / 85.8kg / 189.2 (done)<br>
Body Fat	22.0 (done)<br>
Visceral Fat	9 (done)<br>
BMI		25.1 - (done) Calculated field off ( http://www.bbc.co.uk/health/healthy_living/your_weight/bmiimperial_index.shtml )<br>
BMR		1949 - (done) Calculated off weight, height & age. (http://www.bmi-calculator.net/bmr-calculator/bmr-formula.php)<br>
Muscle Mass	41.3<br>
Body Water 	57.1 - Calulated field not from scales.<br>


--------------------------------------------------------------------

Example User Data String = 07 da 01 01 08 31 2c a1 b9 00 03 5a 00 dc 00 01 9d 09

|| Hex Value|| Decimal Value || Comment ||
||  || ||  ||
||07||	7 ||	YEAR in binary - 0111<br>
||da ||	218 ||	YEAR in binary - 11011010<br>
||01 ||	1 ||	MONTH<br>
||01 ||	1 ||	DAY<br>
||08 ||	8 ||	TIME<br>
||31 ||	49 ||	TIME<br>
||2c ||	44 ||	TIME<br>
||a1 ||	161 ||    Female/Male Setting & Age. 1st bit = male/female. If 0 then female, if 1 then male. Can only live upto 127<br>
||b9 ||	185 ||	Height in cm <br>
||00 ||	0 ||	PADDING! - It seems like!<br>
||03 ||	3 ||	WEIGHT The MSB is not used.<br>
||5a ||	90  ||    WEIGHT <br>
||00 ||	0 ||	BODY FAT<br>
||dc ||	220 ||	BODY FAT<br>
||00 ||	0 ||	PADDING! - It seems like!<br>
||01 ||	1 ||	Muscle Mass<br>
||9d ||	157 ||	Muscle Mass<br>
||09 ||	9 ||	Visceral Fat<br>
|| || || ||
